intro: Alcea kopetdaghensis, commonly known as the Kopetdag hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, specifically found in the Kopetdag Range of Turkmenistan and Iran. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, rose-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features include hairy stems, lobed leaves, and vibrant pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Alcea kopetdaghensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
